item.title: Samantha add a quote by Charles W. Eliot
item.description: "Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers." -- Charles W. Eliot

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "I think the reward for conformity is that everyone likes you except yourself." -- Rita Mae Brown

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Richard Wright
item.description: "Men can starve from a lack of self-realization as much as they can from a lack of bread." -- Richard Wright

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafon
item.description: "Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafon

item.title: Samantha add a quote by St. Francis Of Assisi
item.description: "All the darkness in the world cannot extinguish the light of a single candle." -- St. Francis Of Assisi

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "Those who don't believe in magic will never find it." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "You never have to change anything you got up in the middle of the night to write." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "Language is courage: the ability to conceive a thought, to speak it, and by doing so to make it true." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description: "You have to know what you stand for, not just what you stand against." -- Laurie Halse Anderson

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Kazuo Ishiguro
item.description: "Memories, even your most precious ones, fade surprisingly quickly. But I don’t go along with that. The memories I value most, I don’t ever see them fading." -- Kazuo Ishiguro

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Ira Gershwin
item.description: "The way you wear your hat, The way you sip your tea, The mem'ry of all that -- No, no! They can't take that away from me!" -- Ira Gershwin

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Mortimer J. Adler
item.description: "In the case of good books, the point is not to see how many of them you can get through, but rather how many can get through to you." -- Mortimer J. Adler

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "Hope Smiles from the threshold of the year to come, Whispering 'it will be happier'..." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "When the heart speaks, the mind finds it indecent to object." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Lloyd Alexander
item.description: "Fantasy is hardly an escape from reality. It's a way of understanding it." -- Lloyd Alexander

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Judith Viorst
item.description: "Strength is the capacity to break a Hershey bar into four pieces with your bare hands - and then eat just one of the pieces." -- Judith Viorst

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Charles Lamb
item.description: "Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and to have her nonsense respected." -- Charles Lamb

item.title: Samantha add a quote by William Shakespeare
Samantha add a quote by W.H. Auden
item.description: "Poetry might be defined as the clear expression of mixed feelings." -- W.H. Auden

item.title: Samantha add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "I do things like get in a taxi and say, "The library, and step on it." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Richard Wilbur
item.description: "What is the opposite of two? A lonely me, a lonely you." -- Richard Wilbur

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Patricia A. McKillip
item.description: "Imagination is the golden-eyed monster that never sleeps. It must be fed; it cannot be ignored." -- Patricia A. McKillip

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Richard Hughes
item.description: "Do your bit to save humanity from lapsing back into barbarity by reading all the novels you can." -- Richard Hughes

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description: "Great heroes need great sorrows and burdens, or half their greatness goes unnoticed. It is all part of the fairy tale." -- Peter S. Beagle

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett
